ci.name: CI Integration
ci.description: CI build verification and merge gates

recipes.name: ci-gate-before-merge
recipes.template:
### Wait for CI

```bash
node .claude/scripts/shared/wait-for-ci.js
```

**If CI fails, STOP and report the error.**

Common failures:
- Build errors: Check compilation output
- Test failures: Run tests locally to debug
- Lint errors: Run linter with --fix

recipes.name: ci-status-check
recipes.description: Quick CI status without blocking workflow
recipes.template:
### Check CI Status

```bash
gh run list --limit 1 --json status,conclusion,name
```

Report status but do not block workflow.

recipes.name: coverage-gate
recipes.description: Block release if coverage below threshold
recipes.template:
### Coverage Gate

**If `--skip-coverage` was passed, skip this section.**

```bash
# Example: Node.js with nyc/istanbul
nyc --check-coverage --lines 80 --functions 80 --branches 70

# Example: Go
go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./...
go tool cover -func=coverage.out | grep total | awk '{print $3}'
```

**If coverage is below threshold, STOP and report.**

Thresholds:
- Lines: 80%
- Functions: 80%
- Branches: 70%
prerequisites: Coverage tool for your language (nyc, go test -cover, pytest-cov, etc.)

recipes.name: coverage-report
recipes.template:
### Coverage Report

Generate coverage report for review:

```bash
# Example: Generate HTML report
nyc report --reporter=html --report-dir=coverage

# Example: Upload to Codecov
bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash)
```

Report location: `coverage/index.html`

notifications.name: Notifications
notifications.description: Slack, Discord, email alerts on release events

recipes.name: slack-release-notification
recipes.description: Post to Slack when release is tagged
recipes.template:
### Slack Notification

```bash
curl -X POST -H 'Content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"text":"Release '$VERSION' has been tagged and deployed."}' \
  "$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL"
```

**Note:** Set `SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL` environment variable or replace with your webhook.

recipes.name: dependency-audit
recipes.description: Check for known vulnerabilities in dependencies
recipes.template:
### Dependency Audit

```bash
# Node.js
npm audit --audit-level=high

# Go
go list -m all | nancy sleuth

# Python
pip-audit
```

**If high/critical vulnerabilities found, STOP and report.**
prerequisites: Audit tool for your language (npm audit, nancy, pip-audit, etc.)
